activities: Starwood Hotels & Resorts Worldwide, Inc. receives personal data from the EU and Switzerland, including data concerning: the organization, guests, customers, employees, third party vendors, hotel owners, and timeshare/interval ownership, fractional residence and residential unit owners.  This data is collected and transferred to the United States in support of the company's employment, regulatory, marketing, sales, reservations, financial, legal and other business activities.
contacttitle1: Vice President, Deputy Chief Privacy Officer
corpofftitle1: Senior Vice President - ERM and Chief Privacy Officer
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: Organization, guest, customer, employee, third party vendor, hotel owner, and timeshare/ interval ownership, fractional residence and residential unit owner personal data, including manually processed data.
recoursemech:
For Human Resource Data: EU Data Protection Authorities (DPAs) and Swiss Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner (FDPIC).  
For all other personal data: American Arbitration Association (AAA).
